articles.title: Derrick White gets candid about ‘different’ season that awaits Celtics
articles.description:
"You lose three out of five starters. And even Al. So it’s definitely going to change."

The post Derrick White gets candid about ‘different’ season that awaits Celtics appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Celtics will lose three out of five starters this season, altering team dynamics.
Derrick White emphasizes changes with the absence of key players like Al Horford.
Fans can expect a different style of play as new roster adjustments unfold.

articles.title: Report of suspicious man approaching Arlington child ‘unfounded,’ police say
articles.description:
“The department has determined that there is insufficient evidence to support further investigative action,” Police Chief Julie Flaherty said.

The post Report of suspicious man approaching Arlington child ‘unfounded,’ police say appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Police Chief Julie Flaherty confirmed the report of a suspicious man was unfounded.
No evidence was found to support further investigation into the incident.
Arlington residents can feel reassured as police deemed the situation non-threatening.

articles.title: Man who threatened pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge facing assault charge
articles.description:
The North Billerica man is charged with assault and battery with a dangerous weapon and a civil rights violation.

The post Man who threatened pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge facing assault charge appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: North Billerica man charged with assault and battery for threatening protesters in Cambridge.
Charges include civil rights violation, highlighting tensions around local protests.
Incident raises concerns for safety among Boston's pro-Palestinian community.

articles.title: Patriots’ Will Campbell lands on injury report ahead of season opener
articles.description:
The Patriots' depth chart behind Will Campbell is lacking at left tackle.

summary: Will Campbell is listed on the injury report ahead of the Patriots' season opener.
The Patriots lack depth at left tackle, raising concerns for the team's performance.
Boston residents may see increased pressure on the offensive line during the game.

articles.title: Invasive seaweed stinks up one of the North Shore’s favorite seaside spots
articles.description:
It smells pretty strongly of rotten eggs, and city officials say it’s because the seaweed is naturally decomposing after washing ashore.

The post Invasive seaweed stinks up one of the North Shore’s favorite seaside spots appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Invasive seaweed is decomposing along the North Shore, causing a strong odor.
City officials report the smell resembles rotten eggs, affecting local beachgoers.
Residents may experience unpleasant conditions at popular seaside spots this summer.

articles.title: Police: Suspect caused ATM explosion in Woburn, prompting FBI investigation
articles.description:
The ATM was damaged from what appeared to be a pipe bomb or “unknown destructive device,” police said.

The post Police: Suspect caused ATM explosion in Woburn, prompting FBI investigation appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Police reported an ATM explosion in Woburn, believed to be caused by a pipe bomb.
The incident occurred on September 4, 2025, prompting an FBI investigation.
Residents are advised to remain vigilant due to potential safety risks in the area.

articles.title: Canton man arrested in Dorchester murder
articles.description:
Jordan Evans was wanted for the murder of Shakar Caterson, who was shot and killed May 3. 

The post Canton man arrested in Dorchester murder appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Jordan Evans was arrested for the May 3 murder of Shakar Caterson in Dorchester.
The arrest addresses community concerns over rising violence in Boston neighborhoods.
Residents seek justice and safety following the tragic shooting incident.

articles.title: Eagles’ Jalen Carter ejected for spitting on Cowboys’ Dak Prescott
articles.description:
Carter was tossed six seconds into Thursday night's NFL season opener for unsportsmanlike conduct.

The post Eagles’ Jalen Carter ejected for spitting on Cowboys’ Dak Prescott appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Eagles' Jalen Carter ejected for spitting on Cowboys' Dak Prescott in NFL opener.
Carter's ejection occurred just six seconds into the game on September 4, 2025.
Boston fans may feel heightened rivalry as Eagles and Cowboys clash in season opener.

articles.title: New England governors back wind energy as Trump escalates his attacks on industry
articles.description:
"We are looking for the Trump Administration to uphold all offshore wind permits already granted and allow these projects to be constructed."

The post New England governors back wind energy as Trump escalates his attacks on industry appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: New England governors support offshore wind energy amid federal opposition from Trump.
Governors urge the Trump Administration to uphold existing offshore wind permits.
Local residents could benefit from renewable energy jobs and reduced carbon emissions.

articles.title: Read a statement from the fiancé of Shrewsbury father shot and killed after walking son to school
articles.description:
The Shrewsbury community is hosting a vigil and fundraiser in honor of Kevin Doherty on Oct. 11 at SAC Park. 

The post Read a statement from the fiancé of Shrewsbury father shot and killed after walking son to school appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Kevin Doherty was shot and killed while walking his son to school in Shrewsbury.
A vigil and fundraiser for Doherty will be held on October 11 at SAC Park.
The community is uniting to support Doherty's family during this tragic time.
